entries.content: Sales struggle is due to internal issues (excuses, ownership), not competitor price.
entries.notes: Frames value/success around internal skill vs. external factors like price.

entries.content: Frame value around becoming a professional, like other highly skilled professions (surgeon, barrister).
entries.notes: Positions the training/approach as developing high-level skill and professionalism.

entries.content: Success comes from being a professional, not from having the best product or a winning personality.
entries.notes: Defines the core value proposition distinctly from common competitive claims (best product) or personal attributes.

entries.content: Effectiveness ('best') can come from an unconventional or disliked approach; you don't have to be liked to sell.
entries.notes: Frames unique value around results/effectiveness, owning a potentially controversial style.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
